text: Bottle from a Safeways in San Francisco. Aroma is dark malt, caramel, yeast, dark bread, raisins, dark dried fruits, notes of chocolate, with a slight hint of cherries that I probably wouldnt have detected if I didnt know they were there. Flavour is sugary sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full. Good Quad, lots of bold flavours, cherry is too subdued for my taste. Very enjoyable.

Overall good quad with just a touch of cherry finish that is very subtle but lingers on the palate in a good way. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from Whole Foods, poured into tulip glass. Reddish brown with beige head and dark fruit aroma, medium body with light carbonation. Taste is brandy, raisin, cherry, and caramel. Finish is bittersweet malt. Excellent quad.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Piana dość obfita, lekko sycząca, średnio trwała. Barwa miedziana, opalizująca. Aromat dość klasyczny, mało intensywny - rodzynki, figi, morele kandyzowane, miód spadziowy, zboże i zioła, gdzieś na trzecim planie dojrzałe wiśnie, kriek... W smaku podobnie, sporo słodyczy, dojrzałych winogron, migdałów, olejku arakowego, razowego chleba, lekko winny posmak od wiśni i pestkowo przyprawowa, średnia goryczka, nieco przydługa, drażniąca. Wysycenie wysokie, grube, lekko oleiste, wyklejające, choć nie gęste, w odbiorze. Alkohol rozgrzewający, całkiem ładnie ułożony.

Poprawny quad, nieco zmieniony dodatkiem krieka, przez co mniej słodki, lekko kwaskowy w posmakach i z wyraźną pestkowością, co nie do końca mi odpowiada. Przydałoby się też więcej ciała.

Ps.

W miarę ogrzewania pojawia się więcej rodzynek i chleba, zmniejsza się migdał i pestka ;)

URUS 3.0
Aroma: raisins, caramel, toast, some spicy notes
Taste: medium sweet, caramel, toast, raisins

Opaque dark brown with ruby highlights. A tan head of thin soda that fizzes out like cheap roadside stand fireworks. Rich caramel malt with some plum, raisin and cherry supporting cast. A great brew to get for a smoked meat meal.
Pite na Urusie. W zapachu mało ciekawie, belgijska nuda, rodzynki. W smaku jeszcze gorzej słodkie ulepkowate. Na dodatek alk trochę grzeje po przełyku. W tej kasie no no no po prostu.

Ommegang doesnt do a lot of things wrong. Definitely strong but bittersweet on the finish. Well balanced.

Reviewed - A Brew With You, Ep. 38

Bouteille 750 ml. Couleur brune, reflets orangés. Mousse beige. Arôme de fruits confits, gâteau aux fruits même, cerises cuites, toffee. En bouche, bonne effervescence, belle texture, notes de fruits, dattes, cassonnade et des cerises qui entourent le tout. Cest une grosse bière mais elle se boit très bien.

Amberish cloudy liquid, dissipating head that is only letting a ring around the glass. Nose is Belgian yeast without doubt, dark sugar, small acidity, spices. Taste is ripped bananas, dark dried fruits, lots of residual sugar, subtle tartness, caramel, toffee. Full body, warmth alcohol feeling in the throat. Sublime!

Large caged and corked bottled pours slightly cloudy amber-ruby with tan head and lacing. Aroma: dark brown bread, raisins, prune juice, cherry juice. Flavor: caramelized brown sugar, figs, dates, prunes, black pepper, sour cherry, cloves, cinnamon, plums, chocolate, nuts. Mouthfeel: medium- to full-bodied, rich, soft on tongue, yet a bit too dry from the spices. Warm alcohol finish. A sipper, for sure.
Solidny quadrupel (choć daleko mu do klasy chociażby Struise) z dość niskim ciałem, idący w karmel i ciemne owoce, z delikatnie wiśniowo kwaskowatym finiszem. Przyjemne piwo.

Dark amber color with beige head. Aroma is quite boozy with sugar coated raisins. Taste starts sweet and fruity with raisins and dried berries. Finish has some cardboard and rag notes but not too intense. Medium body and carbonation. Overall its a decent beer but it has its flaws.

0.355l bottle. Slightly hazy very dark orange body with a beige head. Aroma of dark sugar syrup, orange zest, nutmeg, toast, cherries and a hint of booze. Taste of chocolate, dark sugar, orange peel, plums, toast, brandy and floral hops. The alcohol is quite obvious, but doesnt ruin the sensation. Very nice beer.
Butelka w Chmielarni na Marszałkowskiej. Aromat suszonych owoców, melasy. Smak słodki, sporo tutaj karmelu, toffee, suszonych owoców. Trochę brakuje ciała.

opalescent reddish-brown colour, one inch creamy beige-ish head; aroma of dried cherry, cherry, liqueur, some dark chocolate, maybe anise and biscuit notes; taste is the same with burnt bittery plum jam, herbal liqueur and hoppy bittery notes, as well as spicy alcohol; lovely quadrupel

Bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk
Belgian spicy esters, some creamy scents and bread. Taste is malty add caramely sweet on top of boozy body. Dry finish

Brewery Ommegang by Three Philosophers
Rami Rami is drinking a Three Philosophers by Brewery Ommegang at Czerniakowska

Owocowe roznorako i jasno i ciekno, slodowe, ciut przyprawowe, schowane alko, dosc puchate, bdb

Very intensive aroma of lots of fresh, canned and dried fruits. Mostly canned pear, dried apple, raisins, muscat grapes. Lots of toffee, bottom of a tart. The alcohol isnt well hidden but still well balanced in. Taste is sweet, almost cloying. Long and warming finish.

Pours a dark amber ruby red with a floral fruity scent. 
Taste: Ripe dark cherries, tart maraschino, almonds and chestnuts.

33cl bottle at home. Semi-hazy dark caramel-brown pour with a tan head. Notes of caramel, toffee, tons of dried fruit (cherries, prunes, raisins), plum jam, raspberry jam, sweet spices, chocolate. Very nice, quite a few steps above their abbey ale.

2016 edition. Pours an amber colour with a ruby hue. Big fluffy beige head, long lasting with some thick foam lacing. Nutty aromas with some dark fruits (figs, dates) and some caramel malts. The taste has the dark fruits with some nice hops that gives out hints of mint, grass. A little wood in the mouthfeel. Quite a nice Quad that has lots happening.

Pours dark murky caramel color with very little tan head. Aroma is sweet candy prunes. Flavor is sweet smoky caramel with cherry notes. Smooth sweet character on the back of the palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fajny quad, fajne owoce, rodzynki, fajna slodycz, opiekane. Dobry quad generalnie

Rousse. Collet blanc et éphémère. Belle effervescence. Sucré. Fruité. Datte. Cerise. Un peu boisé. Caramel. Finale sèche et un peu acidulé. Très bien. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark brown in colour. Belgy yeasty spicy nose, ripe raspberries, cherry on nose. Med full bodied, light oily, clean finish, little of the abv to bother. Started off quite cherryish, but turned raspberries after a while. Thought it was my flue playing tricks, but apparently theres fruit in it. Goes harmoneously, feels nice. Enjoyable.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Chestnut brown with a large tan head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Intense nose with dark fruits, brown sugar, light sherry and fruit. The flavour follows. Brown sugar, dark fruits, dark wood, caramel, light sherry, dust and mild fruit. Full body, sweetness is balanced by bitterness and warming alcohol. Soft fluffy carbonation. Long warming finish with dark fruits. Very nice.

Bottle, 2016 version (from beergium). Pours dark amber-copper with beige head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, Belgian yeast, malt, caramel. Flavor is sweet, malty, fruity, citrus, cherry, even bit acidic, yeasty. Finish is dry bitter, fruits and caramel. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: great. Im a big fan of quads and this is really good one, it is not as complex as the best Belgian quads, but the sourness makes it less cloying and more drinkable that is common to the style. I also like that they have not overdone the alcohol, 9.7 is low by quad standards, but this is well covered in this beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Castle, NYC, USA. At last, a good US belgian-style quad. Cherry and a bit of plastic and rye butter cookies.

Bomber. Murky brown with an orange hue. Mahogany color once it settles. Big off white head. Aromas of red licorice, prunes, raisins, cherries, wood, yeast. Similar flavor profile with plums, toffee, cola, leather, berries, and significant spiciness. Malts balanced with tartness. Medium body, good carbonation.

Bottle, LCBO. 2016. BB 03.10.2021. Darkish murky coppery amberish colour with modest creamy head. Malty sweet and ripe autumn fruits aroma, some dark dried fruits, caramel; flavour likewise, strong toffee notes. Tastes rather sweet with a slightly spicy bitterness. The cherry is rather subdued, I almost guess I wouldnt have noticed any if I didnt know it was part Liefmans Kriek... Weirrrrd. Alcohol is rather well covered but the mouthfeel is rather thin, carbonation fine and nearing flat. Not among the best Quads Ive had.

Bottle from the LCBO. Murky dark coppery brown under a fluffy khaki coloured head that lingers. Nose is cherry forward, with plum, brown sugar, yeast and light spice. Front is quite sweet but roast smooths it in the middle and leads to a lightly tart fruity finish. Mouth is medium+ and chewy with soft carbonation and a lingering vinous finish. Alcohol is quite warming. Nice sippe.

8/4-/8+/4/16
750ml bottle. Burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are alcohol, raisins, cherry and toffee with spicy notes. Medium to full body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.
Beautiful mahogany color. Cherry aroma. Bold sweetness of currants and berries. One of my favorites.

I hadnt had this one in a few years so I was curious to see how it holds up. The aroma is very nice with a fruity, plumy zing to it. It pours a pleasant dark red-brown with a thin head. It has a sweet, fruity (once again plums come to mind) taste that isnt cloying or overpowering and is well balanced with the Belgian yeast. It feels very nice going down with a lovely sensation on the tongue and a nice long finish. This is quite a keeper and one definitely worth checking out for any occasion. I imagine it would be a good wine replacement for a fancy meal!

Vackert rödbrun, något oklar, med ett tätt fint beiget skum. I doften finns en fin blandning av söta och syrliga dofter av en mängd olika slags bär och frukter, körsbären känns tydligt, romdränkta russin och plommon. När det gäller smaken är fruktig bara förnamnet, lite syrliga körsbär plus en massa torkad frukt,, mycket russin och plommon i rom, sötman och syran balanserar perfekt.
Som en La Trappe Quadrupel med extra fruktsting, suverän. Denna flaska är från 2009 och jag tror att den har blivit rundare i smaken sedan jag testade samma årgång 2011.

Good bodied beer, not great though. A nice Belgian, probably travelled a bit much by the time it got to me. The alcohol warmth shines through quite strongly. Bottle from washington brough back by beamteam.

750 mL bottle. Pours a deep ruby red color with a thick tan head that eventually settles a film. Aroma is mostly cherries and dried fruit. Medium-full body, flavor matches the aroma with dried fruit and cherries and a little bit of warming alcohol. Finish is dry and sweet. Excellent!
750ml. Smells like a roasted glass of moscato. Kicks off just a bit too hard, but eases down into that lovely taste we all want. Its damn good, but just missing that trappistes mark by a hair.

Very nice try at a Belgian quad, just not the top. Great appearance, dark amber-brown body with a slight tan head. I scent spice and dark fruit, raisin and plum. The taste is more like a subdued black cherry, malt and a hint of the alcohol. Rather Chimayish, good effort at the best.

It pours murky copper with amber highlights; the head is off white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, figs, banana, clove, and cherries. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium bitter. The palate is medium-heavy bodied with light carbonation, and has a long finish. Overall, its meh, needs more body.

Bottle from LCBO. Pours dining room table brown with a rather disappointing head. Interesting swirls of flavour in this one: molasses, dried dark fruit, molasses, red licorice, brown sugar & some booze. A little sharp around the edges. Wonder if cellaring would improve both the balance & flavours. But not to worry: this is a wonderful beer to sip on as my holiday draws to a slow close. Cheers.

Bottled. Red brown hazy body, huge even brown head. The aroma is sweet with cherry, vanilla, oak, birch leaves. The taste is chocolate, vanilla, cherry with little or no bitterness except that if dark chocolate at the end. The finish is dry and the overall impression is beautiful.

Bottle from Total Wine & More, St Petersburg. Cinnamon brown, clear, a bit thin-looking. Soft plum, some warming spice, chocolate-covered cherries. Lovely sweet taste, and I have to use the word warming again. Medium to long finish, where the sweetness never fades, although theres a spicy bitter hop lurking in the background. Raisin, plum pudding, crème brûlée in the aftertaste. Not the best Quad Ive ever had but still very good.

Bottle from LCBO. Warm reddish brown with off-white head. Warming aromas of brown sugar, molasses, malt, brandy, hints of boozy cherries. Flavours of cherries, raisins, toffee, roasted malt, some oakiness perhaps. Quite nice.
Beautiful pour, lovely aroma, & complex taste. Its warming while the alcohol is fairly hidden. Surprisingly light mouthfeel for nearly 10%. Very nice!

750ml bottle from LCBO. Pours an opaque ruby brown colour with one finger of head that reduces into a ring. Complex fruity aroma with notes of cherries, figs, toffee and a whiff of banana. Taste matches the aroma with a well balanced spicy finish and notes of alcohol soaked cherries. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Excellent quad with a cherry twist. Highly recommended if youre a quad fan.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky copper colour with moderate-sized, lasting light tan head. Aroma is cherry, toffee, dried fruit, caramelized banana, earthiness and light woodiness. Flavour is rich and fruity with banana, cherry, raisin, candy sugar, toffee, earthy character and a bit of wood. Plus body. Alcohol is subtle. Nice.

Bottle from Beer Culture NY. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with nuts, toffee, cherries, earthy notes, plum, a bit of ripe fruits, sour notes and chocolate. Bitter finish with nuts, earthy notes, chocolate, plum, cherries, ripe fruits and sour notes. Exquisite quadrupel.

Belgian quads are my favorite. I also love fruit beers, so naturally this is something I will love. Has a very smooth non alcoholic taste and the cherry tones are subtle. Considering it is only 2% cherry ale this makes sense. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle pours dark murky brown with rich tan head. Aromas of caramel, butter, cherries and bread and cinnamon. Tastes of salted caramel, glazed cherries, bread and butter pudding, maple syrup, yeast, cognac and spice. Intense, rich and complex with plenty of sweetness and almost no bitterness. A little cherry sourness and a bit of alcohol on the finish. A decadent treat!
Bottle in NYC - Clear brown color with a small, disappearing head. Aromas of rum-flavored fruits, dark malts, chocolate, liquorice. Fine mouthfeel. A bit winey. Very good.

1 year aged bottle. Carmel brown pour with half inch khaki head. Aroma of brandy, walnuts, raisins, orange zest, thick yeast with banana esters, definite cherries. Carbonation soft, mouthfeel a bit thin, crisp effervescent finish. Cherries mix well with the yeast flavors, caramel, plum, bit boozy.

12oz bottle (thanks Jeff!). Pours a mostly opaque reddish-brown with a thick yellow-white head; the head dissipates slowly to a good 4 mm, and very sticky lacing coats the glass as the beer is consumed. A fairly grainy, somewhat sweet-sour aroma has hints of tart cherries with no noticeable bitterness or hops; the taste is a bit boozy featuring semi-sweet fruit notes and a woody/wine-like quality. The body is quite frothy thanks to significant carbonation, but the texture is still fairly light with a slick mouthfeel. A malty, sweet-sour aftertaste helps to create an overall impression not unlike root beer or cream soda as the beer has a very long finish. Very nice.
Bottle from Wegmans. Aroma is a nice mix of cherries, molasses, and dark fruits. Pleasantly sweet.

Big sour yeast and hops scents. Pours a cloudy slightly orange brown cider colored. Enormous tan head with small bubbles. Very subtle for a quad. Kircsch cherry notes of sweetness balance the sour foundation with some nuttiness and a granny smith sour tang. Alcohol is completely hidden in a fizzy, short finishing tangy. Super intriguing, balanced very well made ale.
12oz bottle from Ridgeview Liquors in Green Bay, shared with bananabi11. Sweet malts, nuts, thick yeast. Some cherry. Lots of thick body. Solid for style, not too sweet. 13.8

One of the more classic American craft beers, from the Moortgat-owned Ommegang brewery that, under Moortgats instigation, came to be known as a Belgian style ale specialist in the earlier days of Americas beer revolution. From a 75 cl vintage bottle at Waagstuk (2009 so seven years old), shared with Craftmember, Olivier and Stéphanie. Lacing, thick moussy, egg-white head, hazy coppery amber robe, a tad paler than average for something which is usually referred to as a quadrupel. Aroma of dried fig, grappa, orange peel, caramel, white rum, candied cherries and even cherry jam revealing that some sweet kriek beer was literally added to the mix, dried banana, dry yellow raisins, red apple, lightly toasted bread, redcurrant and onsetting but not off-putting oxidation. Dried fig, orange zest and blue plum in the onset, sweet with sourish balance, medium carbo, caramelly and honeyish malt sweet middle, smooth but already a bit thinned by age, spicy hop touch in the end clinging onto the malt sweetness and even residual sugary sweetness which sticks a little bit in the throat, but is then washed away by a warming but practically non-astringent, brandy-like alcohol effect. Pleasant enough beer, sweet and alcoholic as can be expected from a quad, thoroughly Belgian in style and graciously aged, in a similar way as e.g. a bottle of Chimay Première would.
Since I love dark beers, I really enjoyed this one. So dark that you cant see through the stein when you hold it up to a light. Has a delightful taste without any bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a murky brownish red with a mostly fading light beige foamy head. Aroma is of cherries, toffee, ginger, dried fruits. Taste is of red fruits, cherries, dried fruits, caramel, ginger, grains of paradise, hint of alcohol on the finish. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Pours a leathery reddish brown from a bottle, thick crema head with lots of lacing. Aroma of spiced raisins expands into chewy dried cherries in the mouth. Somewhat spicy yeast background along with some candi sugar and bourbon. A hint of banana trails behind everything else. Although you can tell its a heavy-hitter, no alcohol burn. Very good beer.

Little head and lacing. Smoky red appearance. Raisin hints in aroma. Carbonated on the tongue. Smooth taste with fruity aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[backlog] 17-11-15 / bottle at home, brought home from US trip. Brown red colour. Sweet malty base. Some dried fruits, cherries. Well carbonation. Fruity tartness. Smooth. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3.5/5

Pours ruby red with small head. Aroma: first comes the pleasant cherry aroma, followed by malty sweetness, some candi sugar and Belgian yeast. Taste: surprisingly crisp (thanks to the cherry) first, followed by the quad-like malt body and then again a crispy palate (due to medium to high carbonation). ABV extremely well hidden. I was expecting a richer taste, but still interesting.

750mL bottle. Pours a rich, hazy red-brown mahogany with a quickly dissipating, medium beige head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, raisins, and figs. Tastes of fruit (cherries, plums, raisins, figs), caramel malt, alcohol, and spice. Rich and complex sweetness. Dry alcohol finish that is somewhat bitter and yeasty. Lingering cherry. Strong carbonation. Mouthfeel is a little thin for a quad but pleasing and made up for by the strength of the finish. Flavors standout much better at warmer temperatures.

Pours hazy mahogany with tall frothy light tan head. Aroma of hazelnut, toffee, butterscotch, roasted malt, dried figs, raisins, spices. Taste is rich sweet, butterscotch and nuts, up front followed by a herbal, spicy and funky finish. Rich, smooth and creamy body with average carbonation.

Bottle. A deep amber-mahogany, turbid with particles, beige foam that lasts for days. Red currants and cherries dominate the aroma, Belgian yeast, clove adds a Christmas cake impression. Deep sweet flavour, dark fruits, cherry, liqueur-like booze note, yeast. Doesnt quite do the nose justice. Low in carb and long drawn out smoothness and warmth make it a good feel. Very well done for a non-Belgian brewer.

Apparence : Brune acajou aux reflets rougeâtres, moyennement trouble, beau col beige avec une bonne rétention laissant une belle dentelle, effervescence moyenne-faible et moyennement rapide.

N : Fruits séchés où on dénote particulièrement les dattes, caramel, léger alcool, peut-être un peu de boisé. Intensité plutôt moyenne. 

G : Mêmes fruits séchés, encore une fois les dattes en évidence, bien maltée, léger alcool, légère amertume. Intensité plus élevée quau nez.

Sensation : Effervescence plutôt faible, léger piquant agréable sur la langue, ronde, pleine, crémeuse, belle chaleur dalcool en gorge, finale de bonne durée qui nest que lécho de ce quon retrouvait en bouche. 

O : Très bonne bière où le malt est très bien travaillé, la levure apporte des notes intéressantes de fruits séchés, le tout équilibré et intense. Le bémol principal à mon avis serait le manque dintensité au nez pas rapport à ce que lon retrouve en bouche. Sinon, aucune fausse note.

Unfortunately this second time buying this beer and second time a major disappointment. It seems getting the beer in drinkable condition in central FL is not possible. Bottle pours with thin layer of head that disappears faster than coca cola fizz. Overfermented, harsh and upsetting to the stomach. Hints of great flavors but the mouthfeel is so offputting that its undrinkable. Supposedly ageable beer but not when clearly mishandled which is all too common in FL.
Draft at world of beer in orlando. Expected more. Loves quads. This was avg. Looks great. Too much clove

Poured from q bottle into a tulip: Pours deep red / brown with a one finger white head. Aroma of dark fruit, earth, and booze. Taste is mildly sweet, cherry, prunes, other dark fruit, a little bitter, earth. Not bad, was expecting it to be more sweet.

August 1, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2012. 
Hazy murky amber with a small tan head. Aroma is toffee, dried fruits, dark bread, prunes, cherries, hints of sweet raspberries. Taste is sweet malty and fruity with dark sugars, dried fruits, tiny bitterness and some tart cherry notes. Finish is slight dry with a fruity tartness on top on a sweet toffee base. 
Medium bodied, a bit oily texture, average carbonation.
Bottle. Medium brown color with a slight head. Smells boozier than it tastes. Smooth taste. This is a great beer
pours a medium brown tea color with a huge head of light tan foam. Light aroma of caramel. Smooth caramel toffee flavor. Nice finish with a smooth warm finish finish. Very good but nothing special.

Alluring plumb pudding aroma in a copper brown pour. Nicely balanced flavour profile with the rich malty body complimented by hops and cherries. A different but familiar brew that creatively combines the old and the new.

Aroma frutal y maltoso. Color ámbar con tonalidades rojizas.
En boca explosion de sabores. Dulzor y maltosidad, notas a frutos secos y las notas a cereza a intensificando y redondeando el sabor.
Exquisita!
nuts, earthy, cherry appearance - dark brown, hazy, minimal head, medium bitterness, cherry lasting aftertaste, medium body, sticky, lively,

Pours a thick maple chestnut with a big thick tanned head that continues to stand. Aroma is brandied cherries, smoke, teriyaki and spice. Malty overtones. Flavor is immediately dark. Sweetened coffee, brandied cherries, spice cake, little bit of cloves and cinnamon. Mouthfeel is slightly sticky with tiny soft bubbles. Finish lingers and is brown bread. Obviously a very good and very complex one - somehow leaves me wanting a little bit more but perhaps thats just my expectations. Still an excellent excellent beer.

Aroma: earthy, Belgian yeast, cherries
Appearance: amber with a beige head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

Bottle. Pours unclear dark amberbrown , good white head. Smell is bit malty, some caramel and earth. Some cognac notes almost, even though its not barrel aged. Taste is very oxidized, sweet , some not well aged fruity notes. Given the fact it tastes. Like this, it is probably a out of date bottle ( couldnt find a date on it ) so its to be re-rated when had fresh.

Bouteille. Nez malté de caramel doux, de toffee et de sucre bonbon, fruité (léger de raisins, de prunes, de cerises avec des notes de pommes et dagrumes), léger dalcool doux et dépices (coriandre). Plutôt ronde en bouche et moyennement pétillante avec une texture très légèrement liquoreuse. Goût de levures fruitées sucrées (léger de raisins, de prunes et de cerises, notes de pommes) et légèrement épicé (léger de coriandre, notes de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de caramel doux et léger de toffee (avec des notes de noisettes rôties), léger de sucre bonbon puis finalement, un goût légèrement amer dalcool doux (un peu vineux) avec des notes herbeuses ainsi quun très léger goût de houblon floral et citrique viennent se rajouter. Arrière-goût moyen-long, légèrement amer dalcool doux (et de houblon et de rôti) avec des notes aigres et légèrement vineuses de fruits (cerises, raisins, notes dagrumes). [notes 2005]

Pours deep copper with tan, clingy head. Aromas of cherry, molasses, caramel, malt and spice. Taste is cherry, yeast, caramel, faintly boozy. Overall it's solid, but unremarkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a brown copper color with a huge tan head. Nose of Caramel malts, plums and dark cherrys, some molasse and a bit of spices. Also some brown sugar and a bit of alcool notes. Medium sweetness on the taste. Medium to full body with small to medium carbonation. Finish is medium alcool. Pretty easy to drink for a 10% beer and pretty solid all around

Bottle shared with Chump during Super Bowl. Sweet aroma balanced with malt, hop, booze. Notes of oak, caramel, molasses, dark fruits. Eclectic. Very smooth. God-like. Delicious too. Alcohol disguised well.

Its about time I rated this. 12oz bottle, no date. Enjoyed 4 degrees warmer than recommended... 54 degrees. Forgive me. Pours dark brown with a bit of dark red and a light beige head. Nice aroma of dark malts, dark cherry and just a hint of clove. Clove is stronger on the palate, with caramel, banana, and a hint of dark cherry in the finish. Goes down super easy!

Pas mal ma foi.
Nez très porté sur le caramel et la levure. Fond fruits rouges.
En bouche, on est sur la même chose, les 2% de quadruple à la cerise napportent pas grand chose pour ne pas dire rien.
Après on reste sur une quadruple avec un certain caractère, de la rondeur, du corps. Très bonne mais finalement assez commune. On trouve une petite note supplémentaire qui différencie mais nest vraiment pas extraordinaire.

2014 bottle in LA. Pours very dark brown with off-white head. Very rich aroma, malt and dark fruit esters. Flavour has strong fruity esters - raisin, plum. A hint of cherry and a little tartness. Medium-high carbonation and moderately bitter and dry finish. Excellent quad!
Cherries, molasses, bread, figs, caramel in the nose. Dark brown with thick but light head. Taste same as nose, with vinous character. A little bit tea as well as sourness at the end.

Cherry and toffee aroma, brown to Amber color, taste is malty with dried fruit, banana, cherry. Smooth malty start with warm alcohol finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: sweet cherry pie aroma with a backdrop of vanilla. Maple syrup and dark car as is also prevalent and secondary for me. Hop aroma not really apparent. 
Appearance: very dark copper and hazy. Cream colored head which surprisingly dissipates rather quickly into a thin sliver. 
Taste: much less cherry and much more sweetness, reminds me a little of oven roasted sweet potatoes drizzled with some maple syrup. Moderately sweet, but I think its mostly due to the very low bitterness. There is almost no bitterness at all present. 
Palate: medium bodied on the body and pretty clean finish considering the alcohol level. Pleasantly creamy texture but not the carbonation I was expecting. Very long sensational finish.
Like many beers, Id rather drink this warmed up to about 50 degrees, but in a weather-appropriate situation. The one area I was disappointed in was the appearance, as the carbonation wasnt what I expected. The aromas and finish, however were unbelievable. A very memorable beer.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Serving: from bottle purchased at The Beer Junction.

Aroma: light citrus, soap, cherry and leather.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy, off-white, initial head with fair lacing and mostly diminishing longevity. Hazy, dark-orange body.

Taste: lightly sour initial flavor and heavily sweet finish with average duration.

Palate: light-medium body, syrupy texture and fizzy carbonation.

Overall: interesting flavor and aroma.

Pours hazy copper with a decent tan head. Nose has a pinch of nutmeg on top of decent brown sugar, alcohol, and Belgian yeast. flavor is a similar sweetness with a pinch of spice. alcohol is well hidden. relatively short and dry finish. Good beer.

Happy New Year! My first beer of 2016! Caramel, wildflowers, Ice Tea, cola and light alcohol in the nose. Hazy caramel colored with a short lived beige head that dissipates to a ring around the edge of the glass. Sweet, slick with an oily feel, lots of treacle, bubblegum with light spice. A tad over carbonated for my liking, but still quite good.
Bottle (12oz). Clear brown with big tan head. Lots of carbonation candied fruit taste. Good.

Bottle 0.355l at home, Oulu. Bottled 12/21/12. Best by: 12/2017. Colour is murky brown with very small white head. Aromas an flavours: Dry fruits, dark fruits, dryness, some alcohol, Belgian yeast and malts.

Dark red. Creamy head. Malty raisony aroma.Brown sugar. Taste is buttery malty, sweet, with red fruits. Raison toffee, mainly. Fruit component, but wouldnt have guessed cherry without reading the bottle. Nice.
Bottle. Pours Cloudy Amber with nice tan head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Taste is sweet, raison, dark cherry with a sweet amber type of aftertaste.

Good but not great. Dark, great head in a slow and steady pour. Served in a chilled glass. Malt comes through clearly. Very distinct caramel and oats.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 edition rated. Poured into a tulip. Muddy brown with a thin beige head that quickly dissipates leaving ok lacing. Aroma is stone fruits, caramel, molasses, wood, and cherries. Taste is darker fruits. Plum and raisin, although somewhat faded. Molasses is there too. The oak and tart cherry flavor is most pronounced. Thin mouthfeel for the style. Good beer.

750 ml corked bottle. Pours is a hazy brown. Not much aroma, but what is there is sweet malt. Sweet flavor and a sweet finish. It does not seem very heavy for a 9.7% alcohol beer. I did like the Abbey Ale (Dubbel) better than this. I thought it was more true to style. This is still good.

Wow. I had seen ratings of this and immediately built it in my mind to be a life changing experience, and while it did fall just short of the latter deScription, it certainly wasnt far off. I suppose itd get a full 5 out of me if its finish was just a tad smoother, because I really cant come up with anything else legitimate as a complaint.
Supposed to be a dream beer, pours dark Crimson with minimal lacing. Smell is plums. Taste is sweet plums, toffee and sugar. I may have found a new favorite beer.
Bottle by Matt W. Funky Flanders-like aroma. Taste reveals the Belgian complexity with dried fruits, raisins, only light touch of cherry. Interesting, very good.
Bottle kindly shared by Mattew, many thanks. Dark amber color with me with medium off-white head. Sweet malt, honey, spices in aroma. Taste, sweet malt, spices, honey, fruity, alcohol. Tasty.
Bottle. Pours brown color, small beige head. Aroma of apples, sugary. Taste is sweet, apples, pear, caramel, overcarbonated, belgian yeast.

Bottle to tulip, dark amber, reddish, cloudy /sediment noted. Sweet, dark cherry /prune,alcohol aroma. Very sweet, prune, dark malt, no hop bitterness until mild bitter fruity finish. More flavors in there. Heavy mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation. Definitely a sipper.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: a bit funky and faintly fruity; very complex; Appearance: very dark and glows slightly red in the light; pillowy head that dissipates quickly; little lacing; Taste: distinctive alcohol; some coffee but not overpowering; faint apples; not yeasty; nicely bitter; Palate: full body with soft carbonation and long bitter finish; Overall: delicious, complex and lovely. Would definitely buy again.
12 oz. bottle. Dark brown with off-white head. Aroma of malt, alcohol, a hint of cherry. Taste: malt, caramel, subtle cherry notes. Well balanced. Good carbonation. A nice warming finish.

Flaska blind. Brunröd kulör. Sötknäckig doft med mosade äpplen och belgojäst.
I smak känns torkad frukt, lite barr, knäck och säd.
Söt med avslutande torr och lätt besk munkänsla. Värmande alkoholinslag

Bomber into chalice. Clear dark brown/copper with a slight tan head. Black licorice, Belgian yeast, a bit of chocolate and dark fruit notes. Loads of dried fruit flavor, sticky on the palate and creates quite a boozy warmth. Heavy. Wish I had a seasons supply of it.
Tried both on tap and in bomber. Nicely done. Warm, dark, definite Belgian influences.
Bomber to a snifter. Clear copper brown with one finger tan head. Has the look feel aroma and flavor of a true Trappist Quad... Layers of complex flavor hide the ABV... A delicious beer...

This is an American Quad that appears and tastes as if monks had been producing it for 300 years. The bottle I drank from had been aged for one year, though I have also had the 2015, age rounds the edges and softens this strong ale. Notes of black licorice, orange peel, belgian yeast and dark, dark chocolate are pronounced throughout. with a sweet carmel malt bringing up the rear. A great Quad that flashed me back to my youth in Europe.

I poured it from the bottle into a Stella Artois glass. The aroma is cherries and a warming alcohol. The taste was cherries, alcohol, and Belgian yeast. The palate was very nice. There was a nice smoothness, which gives way to a nice carbonation. As it warms, the smoothness is enhanced. This was good.

12/17/2009 3:45:53 AM Bottle at The Half Pint, NYC. Nice dark red body with slight tan head. Nose of lots of fruits, malts, caramel. Taste also of caramel, bitter and fruits. Sweet, but not too much. But quite fruity (or bitter) to me. Enjoyable all the same.
On tap at Colonial Inn, Watkins Glen. Spicy and malty aroma. Rich caramel and spice and taste. Nice spice finish. Very good.

브루어리 오메강 - 쓰리 필라소퍼스 9.7% ABV 오메강의 콰드루펠. 뉴욕주에 브루어리가 있지만 실제로 듀벨 소속의 벨기에 양조장으로 출발했다. 들큰하게 치솟는 알콜기에 설탕에 절인 과일같은 테일의 에일 

꽤나 고급스럽고 고전적인 레이블 등으로 인해 맥주맛 좋다고 알려진 브루어리로, 크래프트 맥주를 고급 문화의 일부로 소비하는 계층에게 특히 사랑받는다. 레이트 비어 99점이지만 솔직히 그 정도 맛은 아니다.

12 oz bottle from 2012. Shared with ebone1988. The pour is a dark ruby brown with a cap of light tan head and no lace. The aroma is surprisingly full of cherry. There is a little Belgian malt and a lot of cherry. I love how they mixed the Kriek here. The flavor is really, really malty. There is no Kriek present, the cherry all left. It's got a Belgian malt that forces it's way in with clove and a light yeastiness. The mouth feel is thinner than it looks with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly malty and Belgian finish. It started out so well, only to drop the ball. Damnit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. 2012 vintage. Aroma is tart cherry, dry, yeast, caramel, decent. Appearance is red brown, light tan head. Taste is malt, caramel, light cherry, skins, dry. Mouthfeel is harsh, carbonation is high and unpleasant. Overall, so much potential gone.

Butelka. Barwa brunatna, ciemno bursztynowa, mętna. Piana lekko beżowa, gruba, szybko znika. Aromat intensywny dojrzałych owoców (wiśni, jabłek, winogrona), suszonych (śliwki), oraz dodatkowo aromat kwaśny pochodzący z dodatku krieka. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie bogactwo. Goryczka niezalegająca, kwaskowa. Wysycenie wysokie. Piwo jest pełne, bardzo treściwe, tekstura kremowa. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty.

355ml bottle. Pours a hazy, deep ruby brown with a large, frothy, long lasting, tan head that laces. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, overripe fruit and yeast. Sweet fruity flavour of dried fruit, cherries, caramel malt, yeast, wood and alcohol with a dry, slightly acidic finish. Medium to full body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Complex, very nice.

Appearance as clear sediment reddish brown with diminishing creamy beige 1/2 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are cherry, brown sugar, alcohol and rich beady, sweet malts. Taste are cherry blast upfront gives way to Hawaiian bread sweetness mid sip. Toffee, Caramel with warming slight Vicks 44 finish. Palate was full chewy body with smooth creamy CO2, then an Elagant rich balanced finish. Overall a wonderful Quad/Kriek blend, try it. Warms up smoother.

Pretty awful. It had a weird taste to it. Had to try it once, but never again. It's not as bad as some, but not good.

Originally rated on 1/10/08. "This is my second try at 3 philosophers, the first time i got a bad bottle and rated it a 2.9. Today i decided to give it another spin. When poured It was a nice dark reddish-brown, with lots of yeast floaters, looks pretty. Not much aroma to speak of, flavors of cherries, and chocolate, rather malty. Good mouthfeel, alcohol present but not overwhelming like last time. Much better the second time around.
Great one and slow to drink. It is very thick and, maybe it is a trippel but quite good in looks and taste, also in aroma.
Bottle at home, 2012 version. Pours deep reddish brown, nose is caramel, raisins, dark fruit, taste is sweet, rich and fruity, finish is a little harsh.

Dusty reddish brown pour, thin but steady off white head. Nose is dark malt and dark fruit. Leans sweet. Middle is gentle cherries, rich malt, mild Belgian yeast. Finish is sweet and deep malt, hint of chocolate. Nice beer.

Part of a flight at Brickyards Pub, in Lewiston, NY. Pours a dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma is heavy malt, caramel, dark fruits. Taste is roasted malts, dark fruits, wood. Very good.
Full of great flavor...a bit sweet, but I like that! Foamy head disappeared very quickly. Well balanced. Perfectly browned. I will buy this again!
Warm cherry and alcohol flavors. Pours reddish-brown with some white head. Taste is really sweet with a gentle cherry flavor. Thickish body.

Pours semitransparent reddish brown with a thin brown head that quickly dissipated. Strong fruit taste: cherry in particular of course but plum, figs etc. as well and a bit of alcohol. Fizzy carbonation and rather thin in the mouth. Not a bad beer but not a great one either.

From the pop off the cork. .
In the words of my boss, "its the best beer Ive ever had."

At SG75 gastropub. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of bread and honey. Initial taste of malted thick honey with a creamy finish. Slightly sweet with a yeasty bread finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Aroma of Belgian yeast, honey and malt. Pours a clear brown color with a short lasting tan well laced head. Taste of malt, bourbon and honey sweet with a medium body and a slighy phenolic finish.

Csodálatosan szép megjelenésű ital mahagóni színben és rubinos reflexekkel, tetejére krémes és lágy, tojáshéj színű tejszínhab omlik. Autentikus belga stílusú illatszerkezete szinte szétfeszíti a kereteket, az édes, kandiscukorral kikent malátás alapokon frissítő aromájú, néhány csepp mandulalikőrrel megbolondított cseresznyekoktél hangulata terül szét. Mennyeien krémes kortyok közepette merülhetünk el ezt követően a mazsola és pirított, édeskés magvak biztosította folyékony nyalánkságok tengerében, a játékos szerkezet azonban mindvégig összeszedett, naturális és tagadhatatlanul belga hangvételű marad. Nem az a fajta quadrupel, aminek súlya alatt megnyílik a föld is, ereje azonban megkérdőjelezhetetlen, a könnyednek ható test vaskos, desszertszerű komponenseket fog közre, melyek teltek, kirobbanóan intenzívek és jólesően gyümölcsösek. Leginkább az bámulatos, ahogyan a címkén feltüntetett, mindössze 2 százaléknyi kriek érezteti a hatását, s a minden bizonnyal egyébként is nagyszerű alap-főzetbe határozott mozdulattal vési be a névjegyét.

Bottle from Fresh Market, Valrico.
Cuivrée presque pourpre, léger trouble, col fin beige.
Bouquet est agréable tirant son caractère dun malté riche, mettant à lhonneur des fruits noirs allant de date à figue, prune et raisin. Note de sucre candi, malts caramel, Munich, pâle.
Palais est fort centré sur une complexité des fruits noirs; date et figue, profil liquoreux, sucre candi persistant. Cara pâle, once de chocolaté avec un soupçon damertume noble pour la balance. Riche et complexe, à se demander pourquoi Moortgat ne sait pas vendre un tel produit en Belgique.

En olfactif: Cerises, raisins secs, dattes et fruits noirs avec notes de terre. En bouche: Notes de terre, fruits noirs et cerises de terre. Il y manque cependant cette petite acidité de levure Belge propres aux bières de ce style. Complexe dans les sucres et les fruits. Il manque cependant la petite effervescence et la pointe acidulée de levure qui lui aurait donné une vrai signature de Quadrupel.
Aromas of apples, honey, and bread. Taste is like aroma: honey, Apple, bread, raisin, and alcohol.

Bottle, 75cl. Opaque brown with a ruby hue and a creamy tan head. Complex aromas of banana, vanilla, clove, dried fruits. Medium to robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich, smooth and creamy with staggering complexity. Sweet and deeply bitter, with a heavy roasted character and fiery dark fruit, oak and alcohol character. Magnificent.

Bottle, 750ml. A dark reddish beer with a medium brown head. Sweet aroma heavy on spices and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a strong malt character. Aftertaste reminds me of wood and spices. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and considerable astringency.

Bottle to small chalice
Yeast, caramel, grape, dark fruits. Dark sludgy amber with a thin, creamy, off white head with huge retention. Taste is yeast, dark fruit, bourbon.

Bottle 355ml @ Hotel room, Comfort Inn Downtown, Washington, DC
Pours hazy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, dried fruits, caramel and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, dried fruity and caramel finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to fizzy

Three Philosophers is a remarkable limited edition strong ale brewed by Brewery Ommegang in response to a home brewers description of his dream beer. Realbeer.com, the internets largest beer website, hosted a contest called Create a Great Beer. Brewery Ommegang was chosen by Realbeer.com to brew the Belgian-style ale for the winning essayist. Noel Blake, a home brewer from Portland wrote the winning description for what his dream beer would be like.

Tan brown head with a ruby brown body. Aroma of sugar and raisin. Taste matches aroma with some hints of wood.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle, packaged over 9 months ago, purchased at Hy-Vee in Muscatine. Deep ruby red and clear appearance with a frothy and lasting light tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, tart cherries, vanilla, toffee, caramel, candy sugar, earthiness, light spices and light yeast. Similar flavor, malty, dark, vinous and fruity with medium plus sweetness. Full body. A nice sipper, but only slightly above average for the style.

Good rich malty aroma with some oak and tart cherry. Boozy, but not in a bourbon way. More like brandy or sherry. Very nice looking dark reddish color with a dense off white head. Taste is light on dark fruit, heavy on spice, oak and black cherry. I found this to be a bit watery and muted on the flavor; perhaps that will change with age. It has the perfect amount of carbonation, but the palate is lacking in thickness and depth. Overall I found this to be so-so. Admittedly, quads are not my favorite style, but still I have had better in this category. I will be aging a few bottles, here's to hoping it improves.

Aroma toast, bread, raisin, 
Appearance red, hazy, cloudy, frothy, tan foam, 
Taste alcohol, raisin, licorice, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, 
Overall a strong quad that I would suggest to a friend

From a 12 ounce bottle. Turbid red brown with light carbonation. Candied nose. Good bite from the alcohol, a bit of caramel perhaps. Warms your mouth and throat going down followed by a tingle. Can feel the alcohol in less than a minute. Enjoy this damn good beer responsibly.
I am not one to drink a lot of sours i thought it tasted like a carmel apple delicious ipa

Pours hazy copper with a large head.
Aroma can be described as rum and raisin chocolate fudge, with some rose-like perfumous notes too.
Flavours are not as complex or rounded. Some sultana notes, brown sugar and peppery phenols and booze. Pretty hot.
Somewhat of an alcohol flavor. No bitterness. Low maltiness. Last part of a beer pairing.

bottle. Pours brown with enormous beige head. Aroma of cherries along with plenty of Belgian yeast and fruitiness. Sweet flavor with some spiciness. Full bodied with some chocolate in the finish. Nuanced and good.

Pours brown with lasting tan foam. Rich malt and yeast aroma with some yeast and alcohol. Flavors of near-wine grape, with less sweet than the style typically, with bitterness and tartness starting mid-sip and lasting with a dryness. As this warms, the cherry is detectable, but it seems more detrimental to the style than beneficial. Id like to try exactly this without the kriek.
I just had a philosophical discussion about what a quad really is... great beer btw

Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Amber color with a soapy beige head that lingers. Great lacing throughout. Aromas of caramel, maple syrup, currants, prune and some molasses. Full body with a rich syrupy mouthfeel. The fruit and maple really stand out as it warms up. Nice smooth and rich finish.
There is something very incomplete and lazy about this beer compared to a Belgian quadrupel. I hope what I had was from a bad batch....

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 Pours red-brown with heavy sediment. Creamy tan head. Aroma of trop fruit, green apple, boozy malts, toffee and black cherry soda. Taste is same with a sneaky alcohol finish and berries with black cherry and dark fruits. Mouthfeel is light-medium. Good heat in the finish.
This beer is one of the best ever. Going to feed it to you as much as anything ever This is heavy in malts.

Söt lite mandelaktig arom. Russin i sherry. Toner av kola, malt och torkade dadlar.

Cinnamon brown body with a thin tan head blanketing the brew
Spice fruit aroma. Warms the palate on impact. Friendly warming spice to keep you wanting more. This is a seriously potent brew meant to be sipped.
Very nice head. Big body. Dark fruits, plum brandy, earth and spices. Nice hint of cherries. Sweet yet balanced. Fairly dry finish. Very nice!
Pours brown with tan head. Medium body. Lots of dark fruits, maple syrup, finished sweet. Really good quad.

Pours dark reddish dusty brown with a thick foamy head that slowly dissipates and laces the glass. A mouthful is semi-thick with hints of malty syrup, raisin and a hint of alcohol. The lingering aftertaste is raisin. Delicious, heavy, rich and complex.

Not as heavy in the mouth as I expected. Small, champaign like bubbles. Aroma was lacking for me, a faint sweet caremel. Butterscotch, carmel, buttery bananas foster and bourbon finish. Sounds good, but not my favorite
Syrupy taste and aroma, dark brown color with a thick foam. Sour notes and a delicious buttery aftertaste

Another overpriced imitation Belgian ale. Started with a cold one and let it warm up to see if it improved, but no subtleties were revealed. This brewery has thus far disappointed me, although the color of the brew was attractive and, as is common to the style, the ABV was well hidden. The pretentious sommelier logo on the bottle shows the target consumer for the brew, swirling, sniffing and admiring the bottle. Me, Im a beer drinker, not an aesthete, and remain unimpressed.

Ommegang Three Philosophers is a top notch quad. Murky orange pour with a fizzy head that disappears to fast. Aroma is intense fruit notes. Taste is also fruity and smooth given the ABV. The cherry notes are there but blend nicely with the other fruit flavors. Three Philosophers is nice treat in the strong ale category.

Looks..dark ruby red..med-lge head.
Smells..smokey, caramel, some of the cherry kriek, dark burnt caramel.
Tastes..first up cherry.. Candy, spice, biscuity caramel.. Boozy chocolate& cherry.
Overwhelming cherry sweetness undermines any good qualities this might have. Will probably re-rate some day.
Copper head muddy orange color. Light aroma of yeast and dark fruit. Taste is super malt and very very caramel dark surer with a warm alcohol finish. High class for sure

Poured from 12 oz bottle at high 50ish degrees into a Boulevard stemmed glass. Beautiful amber color. Mild carbonation. Strong head initially, and a light lasting head. Strong cherry nose and taste. A bit of alcohol taste, in a pleasant way. Leaves a good taste on the tongue.

First Ommegang, and a treat. Dark brown and murky. Avg carbonation and medium mouthfeel. Tastes of rich malt and grain, a little darker roasted malt. Primarly the flavor and aroma is belgian yeast, sweet fruit and cherry. Unremarkable appearance for the style.

W/ JJ at tasting.
It's getting to the point where it's hard to distinguish flavours and aromas. The 2% kriek in this is far more apparent than expected. It really lifts the body of this beer. Not an everyday sipper but worthy of a try.

Pours a deep brown with a foamy tan head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of plum and fig with some spices. The flavor is rich backbone of dark fruit and a sweet finish over a medium-heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I was so excited to try Three Philosophers that it felt like my skin was stretched over my bones too tight. I then proceeded to nearly jump OUT of my skin when the carbonation caused the cork to hit the ceiling. Fortunately, nothing was broken and, more importantly, no beer was spilled. Best of all, Three Philosophers proved to be worth the wait. With its ruby body and sexy white head, this ale made me half-crazy with lust before I even got to drink it. Aromas got tart cherry, lively yeast, booze, caramel, and dense malt. The flavor was amazingly balanced. Tangy cherry, oak, mild yeast funk, date, and alcohol sugar. One of my favorite tastes came in the finish. The last impression of toasted malt sweetness reminded me a lightly charred marshmallow. Damn good stuff. Ommegang has always brewed quality Belgian ales, but Three Philosophers is one of their very finest.

Bottle.

A- Subtle cherries, wood, berries.

A- Dark ruby color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Woody, subtle tart berries and cherry, caramel.

P- Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, effervescent finish.

O- This is a weird review. I say that because I am reviewing this beer one day after drinking it and I am struggling to remember any decent descriptors for it, yet I know I liked it. So its so memorable its unmemorable. As if that makes any sense.
